subject: Learning
title: Cultural Learning: How Society Shapes the Child
description: One-minute skill: Cultural Learning: How Society Shapes the Child.

hook.text: Japanese children sit still in class for hours. American kids are expected to ask questions. Culture shapes learning.

climax.text: Understanding cultural shaping helps educators avoid treating one culture's learning norms as universal.

punchline.text: Every child learns. How they learn depends on the world they grow up in.

quiz.question: How does culture affect children's learning, according to Vygotsky?
options: Cultural tools like language and norms mediate all cognitive development
